rounds.observation:
[GAME] You are Player 0 in a 2-player Texas Hold'em Poker game.
Game Information:
- 10 hands total
- Starting stack: 1000 chips
- Blinds: 10/20

Available actions (exact tokens):
  '[Check]'  - when no bet is live
  '[Call]'   - match the current bet
  '[Fold]'   - discard your hand
  '[Bet N]'  - open for N chips
  '[Raise N]'- raise by N chips

Invalid actions will result in retries. Use exact bracket format and ensure you have sufficient chips for bets/raises. Check when facing a bet is invalid.
[GAME] Starting a new 10-round Texas Hold'em game with 2 players.
[GAME] ===== Hand 1 / 10 - Pre‑flop =====
Pot: 30 | Current bet: 20
Visible board: []
P0 (Dealer/BB): 990.00 chips | bet 10.00 | active
P1 (SB): 980.00 chips | bet 20.00 | active
Your hole: 5♥, A♣
==============================================
rounds.response:
Holding 5♥ A♣ in the Big Blind.  

- Off-suit Ace–five is a mid-strength drawing hand.  
- Already posted the 10-chip BB and called P1’s 20-chip raise, so we’re 30 in the pot with 980 effective behind.  
- Closing the action pre-flop; choosing to see the flop rather than fold here.

[Call]

[GAME] Player 0 calls 10.
[GAME] Player 1 bets to 20.
[GAME] ===== Hand 1 / 10 - Flop =====
Pot: 60 | Current bet: 20
Visible board: [9♥, 10♥, J♦]
P0 (Dealer/BB): 980.00 chips | bet 0.00 | active
P1 (SB): 960.00 chips | bet 20.00 | active
Your hole: 5♥, A♣
==============================================
rounds.response:
I have ace-high with a back-door nut-flush draw (I hold 5♥ and the flop has two hearts).  
The pot is 60 and it costs 20 to call. Pot odds = 20 : 60 = 3 : 1, which requires 25 % equity to break even. Against a reasonable single-pair or overcard range I’m not quite there, but I have some implied-odds outs (any heart on the turn plus a non-heart ace) and position. A fold is too tight, a raise doesn’t accomplish much, so I’ll take the cheap card.

[Call]
